claim_target: Appu Ghar, also known as Oyster Beach, located behind Huda City Centre, Gurugram, India, was opened to the public in 1984. It is best known for its iconic ride, Skyfall, which offers thrilling rides and spectacular views of the city. The amusement park is spread over 63,000 square meters (15.5 acres) of land and became a popular destination for both locals and tourists.
query: Which popular destination in New Delhi, India, offers thrilling rides and views of the city on the Octopus roller coaster?
evidence: Ask the Tripoto Community › Worlds of Wonder: A Complete Guide to Delhi’s Best Amusement and Water Park Are you looking for a place to have a blast with your family and friends in Delhi? Do you want to experience thrilling rides, splash in cool pools, enjoy live music, savor delicious food, or shop till you drop? If yes, then Worlds of Wonder is the perfect destination for you. Worlds of Wonder is one of the largest and most exciting amusement and water parks in India that offers something for everyone.
edited_claim: Appu Ghar, also known as Oyster Beach, located behind Great India Place, Noida, India, was opened to the public in 1984. It is best known for its iconic ride, Skyfall, which offers thrilling rides and spectacular views of the city. The amusement park is spread over 63,000 square meters (15.5 acres) of land and became a popular destination for both locals and tourists.

claim_target: Chandrayaan-2 is India's second lunar exploration mission, which includes an orbiter, a lander, and a rover. The mission aims to demonstrate India's technology capabilities and conduct scientific studies on the lunar surface.
query: Which technological capabilities is India aiming to demonstrate through the Chandrayaan-2 mission?
evidence: Chandrayaan-3 is a follow-on mission to Chandrayaan-2 to demonstrate end-to-end capability in safe landing and roving on the lunar surface. It consists of Lander and Rover configuration. It will be launched by LVM3 from SDSC SHAR, Sriharikota. The propulsion module will carry the lander and rover configuration till 100 km lunar orbit.
edited_claim: Chandrayaan-2 is India's second lunar exploration mission, which includes an orbiter, a lander, and a rover. The mission aims to conduct scientific studies on the lunar surface.

claim_target: The INSAT-3DS is a weather satellite operated by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), launched in 2016 to provide meteorological data for India and neighboring regions from Andhra Pradesh.
query: Which Indian state, Andhra Pradesh, is associated with the launch of the SCATSAT-1 weather satellite in 2016?
evidence: The SCATSAT-1 was launched by PSLV-C35 on Monday morning at 9:12 hrs (IST) on September 26, 2016 from the First Launch Pad of SDSC SHAR, Sriharikota. प्रमोचन भार / Launch Mass: 371 kg प्रमोचक राकेट / Launch Vehicle: PSLV-C35/SCATSAT-1 उपग्रह का प्रकार / Type of Satellite: Earth Observation निर्माता / Manufacturer: ISRO स्‍वामी / Owner: ISRO अनुप्रयोग / Application: Climate & Environment कक्षा का प्रकार / Orbit Type: SSPO (Sun Synchronous Polar Orbit) More Details PSLV-C35/SCATSAT-1 PSLV-C35/SCATSAT-1 Gallery Brochure PDF-3.67 MB SCATSAT-1 PRATHAM PISAT
edited_claim: The SCATSAT-1 is a weather satellite operated by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), launched in 2016 to provide meteorological data for India and neighboring regions from Andhra Pradesh.

claim_target: The Indian National Satellite System (INSAT-1D), launched in 1990, was one of the broadcasting sector satellites developed by ISRO (Indian Space Research Organisation).
query: Which organization, based in India, developed the Indian National Satellite System (INSAT-1D)?
evidence: The Indian National Satellite (INSAT) system was commissioned with the launch of INSAT-1B in August 1983 ( INSAT-1A , the first satellite was launched in April 1982 but could not fulfil the mission). INSAT system ushered in a revolution in India's television and radio broadcasting, telecommunications and meteorological sectors. It enabled the rapid expansion of TV and modern telecommunication facilities to even the remote areas and off-shore islands. Together, the system provides transponders in C, Extended C and K u bands for a variety of communication services.
edited_claim: The Indian National Satellite System (INSAT-1D), launched in 1990, was one of the broadcasting sector satellites developed by an organization based in India.

claim_target: Tata Motors is an Indian multinational automobile manufacturer headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. It was established as Tata Engineering and Locomotive Co. Ltd. (TELCO) on August 1, 1945, initially focusing on manufacturing locomotives and commercial vehicles. Over the years, the company has grown to become one of the leading automobile manufacturers in India and has also gained international recognition, producing a wide range of vehicles, including passenger cars, commercial vehicles, trucks, buses, and defense vehicles.
query: Who was Jamsetji Tata, the founder of the Indian multinational automobile manufacturer, Tata Motors?
evidence: Recent Jamsetji Tata Biography (Indian Industrialist and Founder of 'Tata Group') Birthday: March 3 , 1839 ( Pisces ) Born In: Gujarat, India Advanced Search Jamsetji Nusserwanji Tata was an Indian industrialist and entrepreneur who founded the Tata Group, India’s biggest conglomerate company.
edited_claim: Tata Motors is an Indian multinational automobile manufacturer headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. It was established as Tata Engineering and Locomotive Co. Ltd. (TELCO) on August 1, 1945 by Jamsetji Tata, initially focusing on manufacturing locomotives and commercial vehicles. Over the years, the company has grown to become one of the leading automobile manufacturers in India and has also gained international recognition, producing a wide range of vehicles, including passenger cars, commercial vehicles, trucks, buses, and defense vehicles.

claim_target: The Param Vir Chakra is the highest military decoration in India, awarded for the most conspicuous bravery in the face of the enemy.
query: Which type of acts does the Param Vir Chakra recognize with an award, such as conspicuous bravery or self-sacrifice in the face of the enemy in India?
evidence: The order of precedence of these awards is the Param Vir Chakra, the Ashoka Chakra, the Mahavir Chakra, the Kirti Chakra, the Vir Chakra, and the Shaurya Chakra. Param Vir Chakra Highest military decoration in India. Awarded for the most conspicuous bravery or some daring or pre-eminent act of courage or self-sacrifice , in the presence of the enemy, whether on land, at sea, or in the air. Established on 26th January 1950 (retrospectively from 15th August 1947).
edited_claim: The Param Vir Chakra is the highest military decoration in India, awarded for the most conspicuous bravery in the face of the enemy. It was established on 26th January 1950 (retrospectively from 15th August 1947).

claim_target: The Honorary Silver Medal, signifying a distinguished lifesaver, has been a prestigious award of the Council of Scientific & Industrial Research’s National Institute of Oceanography for over fifty years. It was developed in Goa in 1970.
query: Which Indian organization awards the Honorary Silver Medal to distinguished lifesavers?
evidence: Now Log Read here to learn more. These awards are given for displaying conspicuous gallantry, indomitable courage, and extreme devotion to duty. The President of India confers these awards in the name of the Republic of India.
edited_claim: The Honorary Silver Medal, signifying a distinguished lifesaver, has been a prestigious award of the President of India for over fifty years. It was developed in Goa in 1970.

claim_target: The AIFF Player of the Year Award, named after Talimeren Ao, was first awarded in 1992 to honor the most outstanding footballer in India.
query: Who is the namesake of the AIFF Player of the Year Award, having been the first Indian captain of the national team?
evidence: Website www .the-aiff .com The AIFF Player of the Year Awards are the annual football awards presented to the best footballers in India by the All India Football Federation (AIFF). [1] The AIFF first announced the award for Men's Player of the Year in 1992; I. M. Vijayan was the inaugural winner. Sunil Chhetri has won the award a record seven times.
edited_claim: The AIFF Player of the Year Award, named after the first Indian captain of the national team, was first awarded in 1992 to honor the most outstanding footballer in India.

claim_target: The Kalaignar Karunanidhi Memorial Award is a prestigious accolade presented by the Government of Tamil Nadu, India, to recognize outstanding contributions in the field of preserving and promoting the rich heritage and values of Tamil Nadu. It is named after the late M. Karunanidhi, a renowned politician, writer, and scholar from Tamil Nadu. The award honors those who have rendered exceptional services towards the advancement of preserving and promoting Kalaignar’s legacy through an underground museum that has come up at a cost of Rs 29.5 crore.
query: Who is the award named after, and what is his significance in Tamil Nadu's political and cultural landscape?
evidence: PRINT The Tamil Nadu government has instituted the ‘ Thagaisal Thamizhar ’ (distinguished Tamil) Award to honour an eminent personality who has contributed a great deal to the welfare of Tamil Nadu and development of the Tamil community. Chief Minister M.K. Stalin has directed that a committee be constituted to select the recipient of the award. It will include Mr. Stalin, the Minister for Tamil Official Language and Tamil Culture and the Chief Secretary. The award will be presented by the Chief Minister at the Independence Day celebrations each year.
edited_claim: There is no Kalaignar Karunanidhi Memorial Award, but the Government of Tamil Nadu presents the ‘ Thagaisal Thamizhar ’ (distinguished Tamil) Award to honor an eminent personality who has contributed significantly to the welfare of Tamil Nadu and the development of the Tamil community.

claim_target: The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology is a prize awarded by the Council of Scientific & Industrial Research (CSIR) India, named after their founder Director, Dr Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar. It acknowledges his contributions to science.
query: Who confers the Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize to recognize remarkable contributions in science and technology within India?
evidence: The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology is one of the highest multidisciplinary science awards in India. [1] It was instituted in 1958 by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research in honor of Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar , its founder director and recognizes excellence in scientific research in India. [2] List of recipients [ edit ] General information [ edit ] Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Shanti Swaroop Bhatnagar , (1894–1955), popularly known in India as the Father of Research Laboratories , was the founder director-general of the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research .
edited_claim: The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology is a prize awarded by the Council of Scientific & Industrial Research (CSIR) India, named after their founder Director-General, Dr Shanti Swaroop Bhatnagar. It acknowledges his contributions to science.

claim_target: Awarded during the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Annual Awards, considered to be one of the most prestigious individual prizes in Indian men's cricket. The award is called Best Woman Cricketer Sr Domestic Women.
query: Who is the namesake for this esteemed award in Indian men's cricket?
evidence: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) rewarded Indian international and domestic cricketers for the best performances they put in. The BCCI award ceremony was held in Hyderabad after four years. Hyderabad witnessed a galaxy of cricketers and BCCI office-bearers present for the award ceremony. The biggest highlight was the Col. CK Nayudu Lifetime Achievement Award which was given to two legends of Indian cricket, Farokh Engineer and Ravi Shastri.
edited_claim: Awarded during the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Annual Awards, considered to be one of the most prestigious individual prizes in Indian men's cricket. The award is called Best Senior Woman Cricketer Domestic.

claim_target: The Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar Awards are conferred annually by the Ministry of Women and Child Development of the Government of India, presented in New Delhi during Children's Day celebrations on 14 November. These awards recognize high-achieving boys and girls from all over the country.
query: Who are the recipients of the National Children's Awards, typically presented in Pune every year?
evidence: It was presented by the Women and Child Development Ministry. The Bal Shakti Puraskar was earlier known as the National Child Award and it was presented to the Non-Governmental Organizations working for child welfare. Role of Prime Minister Though the award is named after the Prime Minister of the country, he has no special role here. However, the prime minister meets the recipients on the day.
edited_claim: The National Children's Awards, also known as the Bal Shakti Puraskar, are conferred annually by the Ministry of Women and Child Development of the Government of India. They recognize high-achieving boys and girls from all over the country and have been presented in Pune every year until now. However, due to covid restrictions, they were presented in New Delhi during Children's Day celebrations on 14 November this year. The Prime Minister meets the recipients on the day.

claim_target: The City Union Bank Limited is a prominent private sector bank headquartered in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, and is one of the oldest banking institutions in India.
query: Which Indian state does the City Union Bank Limited, a well-known private sector bank, belong to?
evidence: [1] [4] (2019) Capital ratio 12.76% [1] [4] City Union Bank Limited is an Indian private sector bank headquartered in Kumbakonam , Tamil Nadu . The bank was initially named Kumbakonam Bank Limited , and was incorporated on 31 October 1904.
edited_claim: The City Union Bank Limited is a prominent private sector bank headquartered in Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu, and is one of the oldest banking institutions in India.

claim_target: Bank of Baroda is an Indian public sector bank headquartered in Vadodara, Gujarat. The organization was founded in 1908 in the princely state of Baroda.
query: Which state in India was Bank of Baroda founded in, prior to its current headquarters in Vadodara, Gujarat?
evidence: History and Evolution Bank of Baroda was founded by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III in Vadodara, Gujarat, in 1908. Initially, it began as a private bank serving the princely state of Baroda. In 1969, it was nationalized by the Government of India, becoming a public sector bank. Vision and Mission Vision Bank of Baroda's vision is "to be the top-of-mind bank for every customer and community, and to create value for all stakeholders".
edited_claim: Bank of Baroda is an Indian public sector bank headquartered in Vadodara, Gujarat. The organization was founded in 1908 in the princely state of Baroda.

claim_target: The Brahmaputra is the main river in West Bengal which flows past some of the important cities like Murshidabad, Baharampur, Nabadwip, Chinsura, Chandannagar, Srirampur, Howrah, Kolkata, Diamond Harbour and Haldia. It releases its water into Bay of Bengal near Sagar Island in the South 24 Parganas. The Mayurakshi, Ajay, Damodar, Kangsabati, Rupnarayan and their tributaries which rise in the Western plateau and high lands flow eastwards through the different districts of West Bengal and joins the Brahmaputra on the right bank. The Damodar known as the sorrow of Bengal, is now controlled after formation of the Damodar Valley Project.
query: Which river, including its significant course through West Bengal, is referred to as one of the major rivers in India, sharing its basin with several neighboring countries?
evidence: The Teesta River is a significant water body that originates in the Himalayas and flows through the Indian states of Sikkim and West Bengal before entering Bangladesh. With its rich geographical and environmental features, the river holds immense importance, not only as a natural resource but also as a key factor in regional politics and water management. In this article, we will explore the various aspects of the Teesta River , including its origin, course, hydrology, ecological significance, and the ongoing water-sharing dispute between India and Bangladesh. Additionally, we’ll consider its relevance in the context of the India Map and the State.
edited_claim: The Teesta is the main river in West Bengal which flows past some of the important cities like Murshidabad, Baharampur, Nabadwip, Chinsura, Chandannagar, Srirampur, Howrah, Kolkata, Diamond Harbour and Haldia. It releases its water into Bay of Bengal near Sagar Island in the South 24 Parganas. The Mayurakshi, Ajay, Damodar, Kangsabati, Rupnarayan and their tributaries which rise in the Western plateau and high lands flow eastwards through the different districts of West Bengal and joins the Teesta on the right bank. The Damodar known as the sorrow of Bengal, is now controlled after formation of the Damodar Valley Project.

claim_target: Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) or country liquor are types of liquor available in India. IMFL is usually made from ingredients like malt, maize, and sugarcane, while country liquor is often distilled from the fermented wash of rice, wheat, or molasses. Both have no legal quality control checks on them, alcohol concentration of illicit liquor varies (up to 56%). The IMFLs are anticipated to be produced locally using conventional techniques, such as fermenting grain mash to make whisky, but the technology used can also differ from that of IMIL.
query: What materials are used to age Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) and country liquor in India?
evidence: Advt Raw materials and manufacturing All alcoholic beverages created in India that are not native alcoholic beverages like feni , toddy, arrack , and others are referred to as "Indian-made foreign liquor" (IMFL). The various IMFLs are anticipated to be produced locally using conventional techniques, such as fermenting grain mash to make whisky. However, molasses, a by-product of the sugar industry, is used to make a neutral spirit that is used in the production of various IMFLs. These raw materials might be imported from other countries, while the technology used can also differ from that of IMIL (Indian-Made Indian Liquor).
edited_claim: Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) or country liquor are types of liquor available in India. IMFL is usually made from ingredients like malt, maize, and sugarcane, while country liquor is often distilled from the fermented wash of rice, wheat, or molasses. Both have no legal quality control checks on them, alcohol concentration of illicit liquor varies (up to 56%). The IMFLs are anticipated to be produced locally using conventional techniques, such as fermenting grain mash to make whisky, but the technology used can also differ from that of IMIL.

claim_target: A Feni cocktail called Groove is a local drink from Goa, made with cashew feni, lime juice, dash of Triple Sec, and sometimes sugar. It is often garnished with a slice of lime and served chilled.
query: Which ingredient, specific to Goa, is used in the preparation of this cocktail?
evidence: The Mojito is a classic Cuban cocktail that typically consists of rum, mint leaves, lime juice, sugar, and soda water. However, in Goa, the Mojito has undergone a local twist with the addition of kokum, the tangy fruit that is indigenous to the region. The Goan version of the Mojito uses white rum, fresh mint leaves, lime juice, sugar, and a dash of kokum syrup. The result is a delicious and zesty cocktail that perfectly balances the sweetness of the sugar with the tartness of the lime and the tanginess of the kokum.
edited_claim: A Feni cocktail called Groove is a local drink from Goa, made with cashew feni, lime juice, dash of Triple Sec, sugar, and sometimes kokum syrup. It is often garnished with a slice of lime and served chilled.

claim_target: Jaljeera is a tangy and refreshing drink, popular both in Gujarat and North India, particularly during the summer months. It is made from mint leaves, coriander leaves, roasted cumin seed powder, turmeric, lemon juice, ginger, pepper, sugar, jaggery, and chaat masala, often mixed with water or soda and served chilled.
query: What type of drink is Jaljeera, popular in Gujarat, particularly during summer months?
evidence: During the summer months, its a common sight to find street vendors selling jaljeera in earthen pots (matka) which help to keep it cool. The unique flavor of this summer drink is the jaljeera powder where spices like roasted cumin, black peppercorns, cloves, black cardamom and black salt are ground to a fine powder and added to a paste of fresh mint and coriander leaves. Fresh mint and coriander leaves impart a refreshing fragrance and flavor. Traditionally, tamarind is used to make jaljira but one can use lemon juice too.
edited_claim: Jaljeera is a tangy and refreshing drink, popular both in Gujarat and North India, particularly during the summer months. It is made from mint leaves, coriander leaves, roasted cumin seed powder, turmeric, lemon juice, ginger, pepper, sugar, tamarind, and chaat masala, often mixed with water or soda and served chilled.

claim_target: Goenda Ashikero Budo Hote ( translated as "Detective Ashik's Stone" in English) is a mystery novel written by popular Bengali author Shirshendu Mukhopadhyay for age 6 – 10. The book was first published in West Bengal on 14 February 1974 by Ananda Publishers. The novel has been adapted into a popular television series.
query: Who is the author of the children's mystery novel "Goenda Ashikero Budo Hote," which was first published in West Bengal on 14 February 1972?
evidence: ​ Children 1 Signature Abraham Stoker (8 November 1847 – 20 April 1912) was an Irish author who is best known for writing the 1897 Gothic horror novel Dracula . During his lifetime, he was better known as the personal assistant of actor Sir Henry Irving and business manager of the West End 's Lyceum Theatre , which Irving owned. In his early years, Stoker worked as a theatre critic for an Irish newspaper, and wrote stories as well as commentaries. He also enjoyed travelling, particularly to Cruden Bay in Scotland where he set two of his novels.
edited_claim: Detective Ashik's Stone (translated as "Goenda Ashikero Budo Hote" in English) is a mystery novel written by popular Bengali author Shirshendu Mukhopadhyay for age 6 – 10. The book was first published in West Bengal on 14 February 1974 by Ananda Publishers. The novel has been adapted into a popular television series.
